title.div: The Private Water Supplies (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2010 / Rheoliadau Cyflenwadau Dŵr Preifat (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2010

div.p: These Regulations implement Council Directive 98/83/EC on the quality of water intended for human consumption (O.J. No L330, 5.12.1998, p.32) in relation to private water supplies. A “private supply” is defined in section 93(1) of the Water Industry Act 1991 as a supply that is provided otherwise than by a water undertaker or a licensed water supplier.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn gweithredu Cyfarwyddeb y Cyngor 98/83/EC ar ansawdd dŵr a fwriedir i'w yfed gan bobl (O.J. Rhif L330, 5.12.1998, t.32) mewn perthynas â chyflenwadau dŵr preifat. Diffinnir “cyflenwad preifat” yn adran 93(1) o Ddeddf y Diwydiant Dŵr 1991 fel cyflenwad a ddarperir rywfodd ac eithrio gan ymgymerwr dŵr neu gyflenwr dŵr trwyddedig.

entry.title: The Adoption and Children (Scotland) Act 2007 (Modification of Enactments) Order 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Adoption and Children (Scotland) Act 2007 (Modification of Enactments) Order 2010

entry.summary: This Order makes modifications to primary legislation. These modifications are consequential and supplemental to the Adoption and Children (Scotland) Act 2007 (asp4).

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Detention and Forfeiture of Seized Cash) (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Magistrates’ Courts (Detention and Forfeiture of Seized Cash) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2003 [S.R. 2003 No.17] (‘the principal Rules’) to take account of amendments made to the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (‘the 2002 Act’), by the Policing and Crime Act 2009.

entry.title: The Export Control (North Korea) (Amendment) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order arises from changes to the EU legislation imposing sanctions on North Korea. When the relevant Council Regulation was first adopted, a range of implementing legislation was necessary. The legislation relating to export controls appeared in the Export Control (North Korea) Order 2007 and set out penalties for breach of provisions of the Council Regulation. The relevant provisions have now been amended to increase the scope of the existing restrictions (they now extend to all dual-use items listed in the dual-use Regulation and also to other sensitive items) and to impose new restrictions on obtaining technical and financial assistance from North Korea. This has made it necessary to amend the implementing legislation.

entry.title: School Admissions (Exceptional Circumstances) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations establish the Exceptional Circumstances body and provide for panels to be selected from amongst its members.

entry.title: The Mental Health Act 2007 (Commencement No.11) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order brings into force section 31(3) of the Mental Health Act 2007 (“the 2007 Act”). Section 31(3) of the 2007 Act inserts a new provision (section 131A) into the Mental Health Act 1983 (c.20) (“the 1983 Act”). New section 131A applies to patients under the age of 18 who are liable to be detained in hospital under the 1983 Act, or are admitted to hospital as informal patients under section 131 of the 1983 Act. It imposes a duty on the hospital managers to ensure the environment of such patients is suitable having regard to their age, subject to their needs. In order to decide how to fulfil this duty, the managers must consult people who they think suitable on account of their knowledge or experience of cases involving such patients.

entry.title: The Criminal Defence Service (Contribution Orders) (Amendment) Regulations 2010

ukm:Subject.Value: LEGAL SERVICES COMMISSION, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: LEGAL SERVICES COMMISSION, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Criminal Defence Service (Contribution Orders) Regulations 2009 (S.I. 2009/3328), which make provision for contribution orders for the cost of publicly funded representation in criminal trials in and appeals to the Crown Court. Following amendments to the Access to Justice Act 1999 made by the Coroners and Justice Act 2009 (c. 25), the amending Regulations provide that the costs of enforcing a contribution order may be added to the amount due under the order (regulations 3 to 6) and that overdue sums may be recovered through magistrates’ courts, county courts and the High Court (regulation 6).

entry.title: The Criminal Defence Service (Information Requests) (Prescribed Benefits) (Amendment) Regulations 2010

ukm:Subject.Value: LEGAL SERVICES COMMISSION, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: LEGAL SERVICES COMMISSION, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Criminal Defence Service (Information Requests) (Prescribed Benefits) Regulations 2009, which prescribe those benefits about which information may be sought from the Secretary of State in order to facilitate the making of decisions about an individual’s financial eligibility for publicly funded representation in criminal cases in magistrates’ courts. These Regulations provide that the same information may be sought in relation to the making of an order requiring the individual to pay a contribution to the costs of representation in the Crown Court (regulation 3). This provision is consequent on an amendment to the provisions on contribution orders in the Access to Justice Act 1999 made by section 151 of the Coroners and Justice Act 2009. The Regulations also prescribe those benefits about which information may be sought from the Commissioners for Her Majesty’s Revenue and Customs (regulation 4), consequent on the amendments made by section 151.

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Counter Terrorism Act 2008) (Foreign Travel Restriction Orders) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Rules prescribe the procedure for applying to a court of summary jurisdiction, under Schedule 5 to the Counter Terrorism Act 2008, for a foreign travel restriction order.

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2010
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Magistrates’ Courts (Northern Ireland) Rules 1984 (S.R. 1984 No. 225) (“the principal Rules”) as follows:—

entry.title: The Business Rate Supplements (Administrative Expenses) (England) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: In England, the Business Rate Supplements Act 2009 gives county councils, district councils in areas where there is no county council, and the Greater London Authority the power to levy a supplement (a “BRS”) on the national non-domestic rate with effect from 1st April 2010.

entry.title: The Council Tax and Non-Domestic Rating (Demand Notices) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Council Tax and Non-Domestic Rating (Demand Notices) (England) Regulations 2003 (“the 2003 Regulations”) in relation to non-domestic rating demand notices only.

entry.title: The Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (Youth Conditional Cautions: Code of Practice) Order 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (Youth Conditional Cautions: Code of Practice) Order 2009

entry.summary: This Order brings into force the code of practice made in accordance with section 66G(1) of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (“the 1998 Act”), which was inserted by section 48 of and Schedule 9 to the Criminal Justice and Immigration Act 2008, in relation to youth conditional cautions.

entry.title: The Criminal Justice Act 2003 (Conditional Cautions: Code of Practice) Order 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Criminal Justice Act 2003 (Conditional Cautions: Code of Practice) Order 2009

entry.summary: This Order brings into force a revised code of practice in relation to conditional cautions (“the Revised Code”). The Revised Code is made under section 25(6) of the Criminal Justice Act 2003 (“the 2003 Act”), and sets out certain matters as to when conditional cautions may be given and the conditions that may be attached.

entry.title: The Football Spectators (2010 World Cup Control Period) Order 2010

ukm:Subject.Value: SPORTS GROUNDS AND SPORTING EVENTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SPORTS GROUNDS AND SPORTING EVENTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order describes the control period under the Football Spectators Act 1989 (“the Act”) for the 2010 FIFA (Fédération Internationale de Football Association) World Cup in South Africa. The control period begins on 1st June 2010, which is ten days before the first match in the tournament, and ends when the last match in the tournament is finished or cancelled. The last match is due to be played on 11th July 2010.

entry.title: The Domestic Violence, Crime and Victims Act 2004 (Commencement No. 13) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 1st February 2010 sections 48 to 53 and the remaining provisions of section 54 of the Domestic Violence, Crime and Victims Act 2004 (c. 28), and Schedule 9 to that Act.

entry.title: The Work and Families Act 2006 (Commencement No. 3) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order brings into force certain provisions of the Work and Families Act 2006 (c. 18). These provisions which concern additional paternity leave and pay will come into force on 6th April 2010. Sections 16 to 20 of that Act came into force on Royal Assent and certain other provisions were brought into force by earlier Commencement Orders (as noted below).

entry.title: The Export Control (Amendment) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order amends the Export Control Order 2008. Article 3 adds electro-statically powered explosive detectors to the list of dual-use goods made subject to United Kingdom export controls for strategic reasons. The prohibited destinations are Afghanistan and Iraq.

entry.title: The Social Security (Medical Evidence) and Statutory Sick Pay (Medical Evidence) (Amendment) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security (Medical Evidence) Regulations 1976 (“the 1976 regulations”) and the Statutory Sick Pay (Medical Evidence) Regulations 1985 (“the 1985 regulations”).

entry.title: The Employment Tribunals (Constitution and Rules of Procedure) (Amendment) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations come into force on 6th April 2010 and amend the Employment Tribunals (Constitution and Rules of Procedure) Regulations 2004 (S.I. 2004/1861) (as amended by S.I. 2004/2351, 2005/435, 2005/1865, 2008/2683 and 2008/3240).
